comments.body:
we shouldn't do dot imports:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6478962/what-does-the-dot-or-period-in-a-go-import-statement-do#comment7619890_6478990

even if it's already part of the framework in mutliple locations.
the alternative is to call `ginkgo.MethodName`.
same for goomega

That's currently the "standard" in e2e test (or at least the approach used in most of the places), and it seems also accepted by golang community specifically for testing https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments#import-dot

However, I'm fine also in changing this, but IMO switching to import without dot only in a few places might increase confusion. If this should be done, let's do this consistently across the E2E framework/in another PR

NB. If your goal is to make e2e test pass golint, please mind that there are also other non-conformance to be addressed (package naming, comments...)

ok
ideally, we should make at least test/e2e_kubeadm pass golint if it doesn't already.

currently, test suites are not passing golint, and the same was for E2E kubeadm before this PR
IMO making this happen seems to be out of the scope of this PR...
